raw_text: Totrain our models we use the freely available corpora (when possible): Europarl (Koehn, 2005), JRC-Acquis (Steinberger et al 2006), DGTTM3, Opus (Tiedemann, 2009), SE-Times (Tyers and Alperen, 2010), Tehran English-Persian Parallel Corpus (Pilevar et al 2011), NewsCorpus (Callison-Burch et al 2009), UN Corpus (Rafalovitch and Dale, 2009), CzEng0.9 (Bojar and Z ?abokrtsky?, 2009), English-Persian parallel corpus distributed by ELRA4 and two ArabicEnglish datasets distributed by LDC5
clean_text: To train our models we use the freely available corpora (when possible): Europarl (Koehn, 2005), JRC-Acquis (Steinberger et al 2006), DGTTM3, Opus (Tiedemann, 2009), SE-Times (Tyers and Alperen, 2010), Tehran English-Persian Parallel Corpus (Pilevar et al 2011), NewsCorpus (Callison-Burch et al 2009), UN Corpus (Rafalovitch and Dale, 2009), CzEng0.9 (Bojar and Z ?abokrtsky?, 2009), English-Persian parallel corpus distributed by ELRA4 and two ArabicEnglish datasets distributed by LDC5.

citing_paper_authors: Erik, Van der Goot | Stefano, Bucci | Brett, Crawley | Alastair, Wilcox | Marco, Turchi | Ralf, Steinberger | Martin, Atkinson
raw_text: We trained two SMT systems, SMTcontentand SMTtitle, using the Europarl V4 GermanEnglish data as training corpus, and two different development sets: one made of content sentences, News Commentaries (Callison-Burchet al 2009), and the other made of news titles in the source language which were translated into English using a commercial translation system
clean_text: We trained two SMT systems, SMT content and SMTtitle, using the Europarl V4 German-English data as training corpus, and two different development sets: one made of content sentences, News Commentaries (Callison-Burch et al 2009), and the other made of news titles in the source language which were translated into English using a commercial translation system.
